item.title: Beyond Rstats -> Rgames
item.description: p.caption { font-size: 0.6em; } While R is traditionally an academically-oriented language (usually statistics) it has moved into some kind of grey-zone due to inclusive philosophies and an abundance of new packages. Thinking about this recently, I wondered if anyone had written any interactive games in R. The answer is “kind-of”. About 2 years ago, Shiny afficionado Dean Attali wrote an interactive game, which is interactive but still lacked dynamic movement of a piece/character, charactestic of many games.

item.title: A Shiny New World
item.description: Disclaimer (and maybe dissapointment): This has no connection to Huxley’s dystopian. Jump to Section: Brief Introduction Example Apps Code and Presentation Slides Resources for Beginners Introduction I recently gave a talk at a meetup in Chicago about an R Shiny app I am working on called IDBac. While there are plenty of example apps for Shiny I also wanted to create some examples of my own for now and any future instruction.
